medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute severe right upper quadrant (RUQ) and epigastric pain, nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presents with a 5-day history of symptoms that began after eating cheese hors d'oeuvres at a flower show. The RUQ and epigastric pain radiated into her back and around her right side. Symptoms were followed by non-bilious non-bloody vomiting and non-bloody diarrhea, which resolved after 2 days; however, abdominal pain and persistent nausea continued with intermittent vomiting. Patient became unable to keep anything down and felt lightheaded and dizzy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Depression, anxiety, PTSD, obstructive sleep apnea (OSA); history of lap gastric band surgery with subsequent 60lb weight loss, right ankle surgery (x2), cesarean section (x1), tubal ligation, septoplasty, multiple liposuction procedures.
medical_history.family_history: History of coronary artery disease (CAD), diabetes mellitus (DM), and hypertension (HTN).
